fields.summary: Allow absolute URLs for icon images
Create 'User Management' permission
Ability to register a SOAP endpoint via the GUI

fields.description:
I've imported data from jira 1.4.1-#21 with success.
When I try to export, I get :

2003-05-13 22:44:11,175 ERROR [web.action.util.ExportAll] Exception occurred exporting: com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport@1c1cfc1, result: error
Error exporting: java.io.IOException: The character '' is an invalid XML character
com.atlassian.core.AtlassianCoreException: Error in action: com.atlassian.jira.action.admin.DataExport@1c1cfc1, result: error
Error exporting: java.io.IOException: The character '' is an invalid XML character
        at com.atlassian.core.action.ActionUtils.checkForErrors(ActionUtils.java:53)

fields.summary: IOException on xml export to file

fields.description: The Updated and Created Dates on the Email Notifications are reversed.  Updated is showing the created date and created is showing the updated date.
fields.summary: Updated & Created Dates on Email notifications are reversed

fields.description: While testing the attachment functionality I tried to attach an empty file. This led to the error message "Please indicate the file you wish to upload". Something like "Cannot attach empty files" would have been more helpful :)
fields.summary: Missleading error message when trying to attach an empty file

fields.description:
This (or similar) problem was mentioned in JRA-122.

Non-ASCII characters are entered correcty into the database, but are displayed as questionmarks ('?').

Encoding is set in JIRA perferences as UTF-8. HTTP responses from the server are correctly marked as "Content-Type  text/html;charset=UTF-8". 

I added <input-charset> elements to weblogic.xml, but it didn't help.

I must emphasise that input is not mangled by WebLogic (as it is correctly written by JIRA into the database). It seems that the only problem lies somewhere in the rendering phase.
fields.summary: Support for UTF-8 characters in WebLogic

fields.description: We should show the file's absolute path after export.  If you specify a relative path, we need to resolve that so that the user can find the file after it is exported.
fields.summary: Show full file path after export

fields.description:
We have been running Jira 1.4.2 in production (Tomcat & Oracle).
I have been testing Jira 2.0 (standalone) - I imported the data from the 1.4.2 database export (I didnt do an upgrade). At some point I noticed that I could not close an issue (it remained open). 
On initial investigation, I found an exception being logged when trying to close an issue. On further investigation, I found an exception being logged when a new issue is created in the first place (though the issue appeared to be created successfully).

When I create a new issue, I get a workflow exception - the underlying exception is "java.sql.SQLException: Violation of unique index:" (I will attach the full stacktrace)

I have since done another export from our production database (and imported it again into a 2.0 Jira), and it seems to running fine - though I dont know whether we will again run into this problem.

What further info do you need from me?
(I will have to find out if I can send you the standalone DB - as it might have sensitive info in it...)

-Nick
fields.summary: Workflow DB problem : Violation of unique index: SYS_PK_OS_CURRENTSTEP

fields.description:
The column Created, Updated, Time Estimate and Time Remaining cannot be used for further processing inside Excel. The reason is that the data is a String instead of a date / numeric value.

For example it would be nice to know the estimated remaining time per developer and project, and Excel could be used to implement the grouping and summing up the individual values. Problem: Excel (at least the german version) does know know how to sum "2 days" and "5 days" because those are Strings, not numbers.

For the Created and Updated columns it might be sufficient to do the i18n correctly. Right now I get a mix of german words and english notation: "8/Mai/03". If I change that to the correct german notation "8. Mai 03" Excel recognizes the String as a date and I can sort the line accordingly. 

Not sure if Jira would benefit from other server/client language combinations (see environment description).
fields.summary: Use Excel types instead of Strings

fields.description:
Currently the normal fields (environment, description etc.) are only shown in the View issue screen if there is data in them. 

But all custom fields are always shown on the screens. It would make the issues a lot more readable if the empty custom fields would not be shown.
fields.summary: Hide empty custom fields from issue views

fields.description:
Currently for a custom date field there are search parameters:
After, Before and In previous. 

If we create a custom field called "Due date" or Deadline then a parameter "In next" is necessary to create saved searches to show all reports due in next hour/day/week/month etc. This would be a great help for tracking open issues and generating alert emails with subscribed filters.
fields.summary: Custom date fields should have search parameter "In next"
Allow logging work for someone else

fields.description:
This is kinda related to JRA-1389.

If you have public browsing turned off, when a user clicks on a project or issue URL (in an email, on a maven site, etc), they end up at an error page. It would be much better if the user instead ended up at the login page (perhaps with an error message) rather than an error page like this.

"ERROR
You cannot view this URL as a guest. You must login or signup for an account. 
If you feel this message is wrong, please consult your administrators about getting the necessary permissions."

In fact, reaching this page is not really an error - its part of the normal usage of Jira.

What we find is that peoples' initial reaction is "oops, whats wrong".
For those that know what is going on, its just an extra unnecessary click in the way of their login page.

-Nick
fields.summary: Login pageflow change - eliminate the error page - go straight to the login instead

fields.description: I have permissions set up so people of "Group A" can only see one project, but when you go to "Create Issue," the drop down box has all the projects in the system, including the ones they aren't supposed to be able to see.
fields.summary: Create Issue doesn't follow "Browse Project" permission

fields.description: Just a suggestion: rename the "Won't Fix" resolution as "Declined" by default. This is more diplomatic (!) and makes more sense for improvement/new feature issues too.
fields.summary: Won't Fix -> Suggest: Declined?

fields.description: On the home page, "Assigned To Me" and "In Progress" displays are shown even for users who cannot be assigned issues. While it would be nice if we could get our customers to fix bugs for us, I don't think that's going to happen anytime soon. :-)
fields.summary: Assigned To Me and In Progress displayed for unassignable users

fields.description:
When using JIRA for the first time, I could not initially work out how to get back to the issues list (filter results) from an issue details page. The browser's Back button usually works, but not if you've done something which involves a form submission. It took some time to realise that the "Find Issues" link was what I needed - I had assumed that that was a general search facility, not related to filters.
I suggest finding a way of displaying a more prominent "return to issues list" link (the 'breadcrumbs' idea mentioned elsewhere might help).
fields.summary: Navigation from Issue Details back to Filter List not obvious

fields.description:
It would be nice if an Administrator could set who the reporter was if we are submitting issues for someone.  This happens quite frequently currently because we haven't have the chance to get people up to speed on JIRA so they are still emailing issues to us and then we are inputing them into JIRA but then i have all of these issues listing the reporter as myself and then they never get an email update.

We hope to get them trained as soon as possible so they can start inputing their own issues or becoming watchers but i feel that even in the future this would be a nice feature as well.
fields.summary: Administrators should be able to set the reporter

fields.description:
We started doing time estimates in days, figuring that one day is worth eight hours of work.  But we discovered that if, for instance, you estimate that a task will take 1 day, and then log 4 hours, it says you have 20 hours of work remaining.  Who works 24 hours a day?

So, we decided to ignore days, and work strictly in hours.  By now, we had realized that 6 hours of actual programming time per day is more realistic than 8.  So, instead of estimating that a task would take 2 days, we said it would take 12 hours.  So far, so good.  But then we entered a large task which we estimated would take 30 hours (5 days).  The next time we looked at the issue, it had a time estimate of 1 day, 6 hours.

Our next try is to start using minutes to track hours, since we can go up to 60 before it starts recalculating on us.  But now when we make printouts or link with other project teams, it looks like we have a whole bunch of tasks that we're expecting to finish in 6 minutes each.

Ideally, it would be nice to be able to configure how many hours are in an ideal work day.  It would suffice to be able to turn off the units and work with raw numbers.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Design doesn't allow reasonable hours of work per day

fields.description: When using the POP Service, emails that have a header of the form "name <email>" are not recognized.
fields.summary: POP Service doesn't understand some FROM headers

fields.description: JIRA performance is slow when using Netscape 4.73 browser. Performance is much better in Internet Explorer 5.0.
fields.summary: Performance in Netscape is Slow

fields.description:
Someone in my organization did the following: Dashboard | Find Issues | View All Projects | Sort on Key

They received an error page back that said:

?  An error occurred searching: java.lang.NullPointerException
?  An error occurred searching: java.lang.NullPointerException


From catalina.out:

2003-05-09 12:04:21,823 ERROR [web.action.issue.IssueNavigator] An error occurred searching: com.atlassian.jira.issue.search.SearchException
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at java.lang.String.compareTo(String.java:797)
        at com.atlassian.jira.issue.comparator.KeyComparator.compare(KeyComparat
or.java:43)
        at org.apache.commons.collections.comparators.ComparatorChain.compare(Un
known Source)
        at java.util.Arrays.mergeSort(Arrays.java:1181)

        at java.util.Arrays.mergeSort(Arrays.java:1189)
        at java.util.Arrays.mergeSort(Arrays.java:1189)
        at java.util.Arrays.mergeSort(Arrays.java:1189)
        at java.util.Arrays.mergeSort(Arrays.java:1189)
        at java.util.Arrays.sort(Arrays.java:1128)
        at java.util.Collections.sort(Collections.java:121)

h(DefaultSearchProvider.java:64)

IssueManager.java:134)

IssueManager.java:82)

IssueNavigator.java:279)

igator.java:177)
        at webwork.action.ActionSupport.execute(ActionSupport.java:114)
...
fields.summary: Null pointer exception when sorting search results

fields.description: We need the capability to conduct NOT queries.  For example, I want to query all issues assigned to me and not assigned a future version.
fields.summary: Find issues -  need more boolean operators for queries

fields.description:
When the work log is created, an option list is presented where I can specify who should be able to see the work log.

Unfortuntaly this down not seems to be working, other users(issue creator) can see the work log and the issue creator is getting an email even if he/she is not the me,ber of the given group.

I think that that that only the project administrator should be able to set the conntent of this option list. Individual developers shall not be able to set who is seeing thei job log.

If a user is not a member of the allowed group, he/she shall not get notifications and shall not be able to see the job log, even he/she is the createor of the issue.

(Also, in the change history the timespent values are visible for other users.)

Unfortunately this makes us the job log function unusable.

Regards: akos
fields.summary: problem with job log permissions.

fields.description: Someone had resolved an issue in one project and after it was resolved i moved it to a different project, but it still counted resolved under the original project even though it didn't exist.  In the original project, it shows 1 for resolved, but when you click to see what that issue is, nothing is shown.
fields.summary: Browse Project:  Issue Count is incorrect after an issue is moved to a different project

fields.description:
It seems JIRA does not support foreign character sets, such as the german umlaut characters:

??? ??? ?

or french characters:

? ? ? 

etc. 

This is probably critical for sales of this product in non-english countries.
fields.summary: Umlaut characters such as ??? ??? ? don't work

fields.description:
From Stephen Butler via email:

Hello,

I created a custom field called "External ID" limited to one project.  There's no problem viewing that project when the user clicks "Excel" in the issue navigator.  In all _other_ projects, the exported excel spreadsheet has an extra "External ID" column.

There's another project that needs such a field, so I added a similar project-limited custom field.  Now, in all projects besides the two containing a custom field, there are _two_ extra "External ID" columns in the spreadsheet.

There is no problem with the other views (browser, printable, full content, or xml).  Only the Excel export view is affected.

Thanks,
Steve
fields.summary: Excel export contains wrong custom field columns

fields.description:
Currently when viewing an issue (ViewIssue.jspa), you see a good summary of the issue and all the comments.

The only thing that is missing IMO is some context to the comments - like "closed", "resolved", "re-opened", "assigned" etc 

I realise that there is a change history - but it doesnt show the comments.

Essentially, it just lacks the marrying of the two important bits of information - the comment and the action.

-Nick
fields.summary: Issue Comments should show some brief action context

fields.description:
Perhaps there is an explanation for this - but as far as I can see this is a bit of a bug.

When you resolve an issue, why would it be assigned to the person who resolved it?

I suggest that the fix that makes most sense is that the the label changes from "Assignee" to "Resolver" (it seems that all the rest - filtering in reports etc all works fine).

I would also suggest that on re-opening an issue the assignee should be treated in much the same way as when creating an issue (either it goes back to the lead developer - or the user gets to choose (and one of the choices is the "last assignee before it was closed").


-Nick
fields.summary: Resolving an Issue changes the assignee to the resolver

fields.description:
The current mail queue lists the outstanding messages but does not provide any method to manage them or to determine which user a particular message is meant for.

For instance, I currently have one message in the queue.  Reviewing the logs, I can see that it is failing due to a relay problem indicating that the email address is probably invalid or that the server is misconfigured.  However, neither the Jira UI nor the logs tell me which user it is.  Also, I cannot delete this message from the queue.
fields.summary: Mail Queue management features

fields.description:
It is far easier to get accurate environment information from a given user if they can set it up once and then select it from a menu for each new issue.  The user should be able to edit the configuration but, once the menu item is selected for a given issue the settings should be stored with the issue and not linked to the user's saved configs.

Per user files:  If it were possible to store files for each user, these could be used in place of the enviroment information.  (in my setup, most users can provide an Apple System Profiler report that completely describes the computing environment)
fields.summary: Store user's environment field

fields.description: On occasion, it is nice to see who is logged into the database at any given time.
fields.summary: Ability to see users currently logged in

fields.description:
From your home page, click on a project name to browse the project.

Under the Components column, it only displays the components which have open issues.

I know this is by design, but it confused me at first.  Someone else just complained to me that the component he had entered did not register because it didn't show up in this list.

It might be more intuitive to display all components, with the number 0 next to any that do not have open issues.
fields.summary: Include components with no issues in Browse Project view

fields.description: When you create an issue it must be because that you want it to be fixed. Then it doesn't make sense that you can vote for your own issue. In fact it puts other people?s issues behind yours (if they do not remember to vote on their own)
fields.summary: It should not be possible to vote on your own issues

fields.description: I get a "Invalid start character '+'" error when I click on "Find Issues" and then create a new serch on "+vote +own". I can instead use "vode AND own", but according to the manual it should be possible to use the boolean operator '+'.
fields.summary: Find query cannot start with boolean operator '+' (plus)
Close JIRA for anybody else than JIRA administrators

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1648].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 6 February 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thank you for your feedback and votes; however, we have decided to close this issue. As you can see from the history, this issue has been open for almost 12 years, yet I do not expect it to be on the JIRA team's roadmap in the foreseeable future. It is unlikely we will resolve it as described in the original request.

The easiest way to view issues that you have looked at recently is to use the [issueHistory() function|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Advanced+Searching+Functions#AdvancedSearchingFunctions-issueHistory()]. This is easily accessible by clicking "More..." under the "Recent Issues" section of the Issues menu.

If you find yourself needing to frequently track issues you have commented on, we recommend [enabling the "autowatch" preference|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Commenting+on+an+Issue].

Alternatively, this function has been implemented in a number of JIRA add-ons:

* [JQL Pro|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/jql-pro]
* [Your JQL & Workflow Tools|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/pt.lt.lfcribeiro.jira.jqlLTFunctions]
* [AM Utils|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/ru.andreymarkelov.atlas.plugins.utils]
* [JQL Tricks Plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.j-tricks.jql-plugin]

As is the case with all issues on jira.atlassian.com, closing this issue does not mean this functionality will never be a part of JIRA by default. However, the JIRA product management team is making an effort to make jira.atlassian.com a more valuable tracking tool by closing the issues that we do not expect to work on in the reasonably foreseeable future.

As always, please do not hesitate to contact me directly with questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
JIRA Product Manager
{panel}

*Original request description:*

Hi,

Our users would like to search on issues he has added comments to.  It would be a handy way to choose issues to be watched.

We can currently search on text within comments, but not filter on comment-authors.

In the filter page, perhaps as one of the attribute fields, there could be a field for "Includes Comment By".

Thanks,
Steve

------------------------------------------------------------------------
Stephen Butler, Software Logistics Dept.
SOLINET GmbH Solutions for Innovative Networks
Mittlerer Pfad 26, 70499 Stuttgart, Germany
Tel +49 711 1398 1357, Fax +49 711 866 1240
fields.summary: Allow search on issues I have commented

fields.description: When sorting issues by PRIORITY the highest level is 2nd not the top. This did not happen in V1.nn releases
fields.summary: Priorities not sorted in correct sequence

fields.description: When you resolve and close an issue the person performing the task is assigned this issue. This way I lose the ability to quickly determine how many tasks have been closed for a particular individual. The people closing the tasks are NOT the people I had originally assigned to them. This did not happen on the V1.nn releases
fields.summary: Assignee chnaged when resolving and closing tasks

fields.description: I know currently the View By drop down only includes groups that you belong to, but it would be nice if you are a member of the Administrator's group that you could see all of the groups listed.
fields.summary: Comments View By

fields.description:
Currently when  you create an issue and attach an attachment to the issue, then assign the issue to someone, the e-mail sent to the assignor does not receive the attachment.  

In our environment we have various vendors that are involved in resolving issues.  Because of security concerns and use of remote site we do not want to give them direct JIRA access.  We prefer that when the assigned e-mail is distributed it should contain the attachment.
fields.summary: Need to attach Attachments to issues when assigned

fields.description: If I have a version named "2.3.1 Beta 1" I canot rename it to "2.3.1 beta 1" (with 'b' instead of 'B'). This is because that it runs a check to see if another version already exist with the same name. It should ofcause do this, but just not count in the version being renamed.
fields.summary: Uable to rename version name (case related)

fields.description:
We should ask for a 'home' directory instead of an index, attachments directory.

Then we can have:
- indexes
- attachments
- backup (using backup service)
- config (for user-config)

We should install the backup service by default (using ZIP compression).

We should also allow people to put their own config xml files into the config directory so that they don't have to open up the war file.
fields.summary: Create home directory instead of index & attachment directory

fields.description:
If Upgrade Manager determines that an upgrade is needed - do the following tasks:

- backup JIRA
- run upgrade 
- if any errors - add them to application errors so that JIRA doesn't start.  Application error should link to the file.  It should recommend that it be emailed to atlassian to check for errors.  
- It can also recommend the location to download the version that they were previously running 

Where to backup file to?

- index directory (or JIRA-root in future)
- backup service directory
- javax.servlet.temp directory
fields.summary: Backup JIRA before running upgrade tasks

fields.description:
our QA group would like the capability on a per project or per issue-type (or both) basis to specify whether certain fields are required or optional.

this is kind of like the way that the administrator can set whether or not to "allow unassigned issues" but much more configurable.

this would apply to predefined fields (though some - such as summary, priority, etc. - would be always required by JIRA) as well as custom fields.
fields.summary: mandatory fields

fields.description:
it is not currently possible to tell from the saved filters list which filters are global (and which are shared by group)

the preset filters that exist today the project overview as well as the home portal are very similar to global filters, but they are static -- we can't change them.

we'd like to see the concepts of preset filters and global filters merged. if a shared filter had search criteria specific to a given project, it would appear only on that project's list. otherwise it would appear on all projects lists, as well as the saved filters list (so it could be run cross-project) with an icon delineating that it was shared.
fields.summary: merge saved/global filters with "preset filters"
aggregate functions in search fields

fields.description:
we need the capability to see the number of issues in a given (or multiple given) status by day(/week) for a date range (required) and any optional search criteria (i.e. component/release) etc.

this would be used to allow us to "see the curve" to make sure as we near a release that the number of open issues is actually decreasing by day.

ultimately we'd like to see both a table and a chart, but just the table will give us enough to have Excel generate the chart.

the reason I request this as a separate report in JIRA is that its not terribly easy to create this as a SQL report. the easiest (not necessarily the most efficent) way to generate it is to select all matching issues and then for each date in the range walk through the list and count. maybe there's a quick/easy way with SQL that I'm missing...
fields.summary: report need - open issues by day

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1636].
  {panel}

in addition to the create/update timestamps, it would be great to have the dates that issues were assighed/inprogress/resolved/(built?, see JRA-568)/reopened/closed.

this would allow us to create escalation workflows - i.e. if a blocker is not marked inprogress within a certain timeframe, as well as management reports, of which I can think of several right offhand:

1. time-to-assign (since created)
2. time-to-resolve (since assigned)
3. time-to-test (since built)
4. number of issues that were reopened (you can't currently tell if an issue was ever reopened once it has been resolved)
fields.summary: status dates (for workflow and reporting)

fields.description: we would like to have the ability (probably via a checkbox) to "not" any field in a search criteria, i.e. "not assignee=tdawson"
fields.summary: "not" qualifier on fields for searching

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-1633].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 22 April 2015|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

At this time, this suggestion is not on the JIRA development roadmap. There are [quite a few add-ons on the Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=jira&category=&cost=&hosting=&marketingLabel=&q=duplicate] that offer this functionality.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

we'd very much like to have a 'find similar' feature when creating issues, in order to reduce the number of duplicate issues that are created. this is the one feature that Scarab had that we miss.
fields.summary: 'find similar' feature to prevent creating duplicate issue

fields.description:
Jira is sending wrong mimetype for the stylesheet.

I get the following warning when using Camino (Mozilla clone) 0.7 on osx 10.2.5:

2003-05-03 17:32:54.954 Camino[9073] JS error: The stylesheet http://jira.atlassian.com/styles/global_css.jsp was loaded as CSS even though its MIME type, "text/html", is not "text/css".
fields.summary: Jira is sending wrong mimetype for the stylesheet

fields.description: It would be nice if projects could be nested. For example, separation of code that generates jar files could be in separate projects all linked  to a master project.
fields.summary: Nested Projects...

fields.description:
Just a request to consider some type of spell checking functionality in a future version of JIRA. 

To save embarrassment regarding my poor spelling skills, I often copy out the issue title and description text to a word processor, fix any spelling errors after a spell check and copy the text back in. It would be nice if I could do this directly in JIRA.
fields.summary: Spell Check on JIRA Create / Edit issue page

fields.description:
I wanted to search our database for issues related to "copyright".  I couldn't tell from the documentation whether the search was case-insensitive, so I decided to use the fuzzy search option, "copyright~".  I got the error message:

Issue Navigator 
Errors: 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.NullPointerException 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.NullPointerException 
 
The Issue Navigator allows you to browse all the issues in the system. Filters allow you to limit the issues that you see. 

Using the panel on the left, you can create and edit new filters. 

ERRORS: 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.NullPointerException 
An error occurred searching: java.lang.NullPointerException
fields.summary: Error using fuzzy search

fields.description:
Our group is using JIRA with the Extreme Programming methodology.  We need to be able to print out issues and move them around on a table to juggle priorities.  It's important to see at a glance which issues are New Features, Improvements, Tasks, and so on.  Likewise, we need to be able to tell the relationships between issues, as indicated by Issue Links.

The most obvious solution is to set up an appropriate filter and go to Full Content to print them out.  However, this is only useful if Full Content can be configured to display Issue Type and Issue Links.

Otherwise, we have to print the detail page for each issue separately, which is extremely tedious when we have dozens of issues, not to mention wasteful.

(BTW, I think JIRA is a great product, and well suited for our needs - especially if we can get a few things tweaked, like this one.)
fields.summary: Show Issue Type and Issue Links in Full Content

fields.description: When URLs are automatically linked up in the description and comment fields, clicking them loads in the current window. Could they open in a new window instead?  This would let me view a URL to see what a user is talking about, without losing my issue.  (I'm a fan of multiple browsers, some people aren't. I also compare what's on the URL with what the user describes in the issue, so I like both to be open.)  I'd suggest the link stay in the current window for automatically linked JIRA issue links, however (I'm still using the app, so I want it in the same window).
fields.summary: Make URLs linked in description and comments load in new window

fields.description:
It would be a great improvement if it was possible to tell JIRA witch user groups that could view an issue.

This could be done with a "Viewable By" just like when adding comment to an issue.
fields.summary: Viewable By field on issues

fields.description:
A lot of people cannot access our JIRA server on the local intranet.  After entering the login and password and hitting "Log In" the browser just seems to reload the login page.  The username and password are both correct.  The problem seems to affect people using IE6.0, but I'm not sure on this.

I assume that there is a default setting in IE6.0 that keeps the user from logging in.  Nontheless, I think JIRA should somehow notify the user why the login doesn't work.  Or if that is not possible include a link to a help page.
fields.summary: Cannot get past login page

fields.description:
It is possible to create a user with a trailing space in the username.  I think this should be checked and prohibited, because it isn't very nice and some operations in the web interface don't work then (e.g. delete the user).

We actually added a user "test " to our users by mistake.  On the Administration page it wasn't possible to delete this user, since JIRA complained it didn't exist.  The solution was to manually enter the URL secure/admin/user/DeleteUser!default.jspa?name=test%20.  (Note the trailing "%20".)

Leading spaces seem to be less of a problem, but I suppose it would be a good idea to disallow that as well.
fields.summary: Check username format when creating new user
Export Change Log

fields.description: I've noticed that some emails are sent out in a plain text format and others are sent in an HTML format which looks really sweet.  It would be nice if a user could specify in their profile what format they would like to receive and then all emails sent to that user would be in that format.
fields.summary: Email Format Option

fields.description:
It would be nice to have a Status for Q/A (Testing, Verifying, etc...) in the default install.  I myself don't really have the time to figure out how to add this manually (which I read somewhere that you can do).

I'm sure other people would benefit from this feature.
fields.summary: Status:  Add a Q/A Status

fields.description:
Steps to Reproduce:

- Create a new group
- Search on the IssueNavigator for issues assigned to that group.

You get an error saying that the group doesn't exist.
fields.summary: Error when searching on newly created groups

fields.description:
One custom field was a 'number field', and the other was a short 'select list' with two items in it. Both custom fields were for a specific project's issues.

When I deleted the project (a testing project, not a real one), the custom fields remained, as seen in the adminstrator's 'View Custom Fields' section. They also claimed to now be associated with a project which had the same name as the custom field, but this was not a real project.
fields.summary: Deleting project with custom fields does not delete fields.

fields.description:
All projects are visible to users under Dashboard Config - Add Project, when their permissions are set at project level to allow access only to a single project.

This does not allow access to the issues within other projects but does allow users to see what projects are stored within Jira.
fields.summary: All projects visible in Dashboard Config - Add Project - Save Portlet: Project regardless of permissions
ServiceUtils.findIssuesInString(..) does not work if string has a \r in it.

fields.description:
In the header line of each portlet there could be a edit button (or image) to be able to modify the appearance. 

There could also be a remove (X) button (or image).
fields.summary: Edit and remove portlets directly from dashboard

fields.description:
JIRA seems to keep messages in the mail queue until they can be sent. Which may be indefinite if the mail is refused by the SMTP server.  This is only apparent when inspecting the output to stdout and stderr.

It would be nice if JIRA would display these errors with the item in question on the Mail Queue administration page or notify the administrator of JIRA by email.

For example we had the case that the SMTP server would respond with "550 Relaying is prohibited" to a partivular item.  Of course that is something that should be fixed in the configuration of our mail setup, but it would still be nice if the error was displayed somewhere else than in the console.
fields.summary: Displaying errors originating from mail queue
Automatic linking of bug names to issues could be "smarter".

fields.description: We should allow an option to flush the queue through the web interface in case the scheduler scrambles itself.
fields.summary: Ability to flush mail queue through web interface

fields.description: Our system is password protected, when we retrieve the XML and don't have permissions and error is caused; it would be really handy if an RSS compatible error page was returned so that a half-decent error message could be displayed.
fields.summary: An RSS compatible error page would be v. handy

fields.description:
One of our users created an issue with the following title:

Clicking "Continue Shopping" button on Welcome! page --> We're Sorry

When you link to this issue, and view the link on another issue, the display is not quite what is expected. Instead of seeing the link with the issue number, then the text (like, "ECR-32 Clicking..."), I actually see the last two words first with the issue number, both clickable, then the rest of the issue title.

Assuming this has something to do with it's use of the bracket. Probably just need to HTML encode it.
fields.summary: Issue name with quote character affects link display

fields.description: Some kind of row of assigned users?
fields.summary: Abillity to assign more than one user

fields.description: Provide functionality to backup and restore individual projects rather than the entire database.
fields.summary: Import / Export (backup / restore) individual projects

fields.description:
I try the excel view for a filter

I get the pop-up prompting me to save the file.
I save the xls worksheet.

When I try opening it, I get the error 'cannot read the file'

Can someone help with this?
thanks
fields.summary: Cannot export issues in to excel

fields.description:
A Project may have a number of Issue Types which are only a relative to that Project and not to all other Projects held within Jira.

Being able to assign Issue Types to Projects will remove all bar the relative options from the Issue Type selection list on Create New Issue.
fields.summary: Allow Issue Types to be configurable to specific Projects

fields.description: Add buttons to move a portlet to first and last position in the dashboard configuration.
fields.summary: Move first & last buttons in dashboard configuration

fields.description:
It would be great if the upgrade process would take care of verifying and creating pertinent database indexes.

I think that ofbiz does not allow to do that but it woud be possible to do it either in ofbiz (better I think) or Jira.

If index creation failure would be reported as warnings. There could be an option to turn off the warnings.
fields.summary: Database Indexing

fields.description: Order of Custom Field Options under Administration is not reflected in select list when creating New Issue.
fields.summary: Reorder of Custom Field Options has no effect

fields.description: Availability of 'Unknown' component should be controlled by Jira administrator or should only appear if no components are created.
fields.summary: No way to remove 'Unknown' from Component/s list in Create Issue

fields.description: Links to resolved issues are not crossed out, seemingly if the issue that has the links is open.  See JRA-1526 for example, where the link to JRA-757 should be crossed out.  The return link is crossed out correctly.
fields.summary: Resolved links are not crossed out

fields.description:
When changing an issue from assigned to unassigned, the confirmation email has a small error in it of the form

Assignee: $userutils.getUser($username).fullName 


This shows up when email preference is HTML, I have not tested plain text.
fields.summary: confirmation email error: assigned->unassigned

fields.description: This is very interesting. This issue was correctly resolved, and then our user just went in and closed it. Now, when you view it visually it's completely messed up. The link is shown, then it says there are no comments, but I know there were because I had put comments in there.  Will attach screenshot.  Let me know if you want me to send you our data file.
fields.summary: Visual of an issue messed up after close

fields.description:
Currently only the reporter and assigned to person get JIRA updates on an issue. I would like to include a few other people and keep them in the loop about developments.

Is it possible with the current version or is it a new feature currently not supported?
fields.summary: Allow more than one user on a JIRA (other than the reporter and assigned to)

fields.description:
Change the name of XML import / export to be XML backup / restore.  

This is a more accurate description of its function, and also allows us to use XML import for true XML import.
fields.summary: Change XML import/export to be backup/restore

fields.description:
I set up a filter on the text string DISPOSITION and checked to search on the "Comment" field only. All other fields I set to their defaults.  In addition to the records I expected, I got four records with no trace of the word DISPOSITION in their comment fields. These issues as well as others had the word DISPOSITION in their Comment field previously, but the Comment with that text was deleted. I am wondering if the record of that comment was not deleted in the database and thus it is coming back with a match.

We migrated from a previous version of JIRA that seemed to have an issue with the Comment deletion feature which is why I am suspicious that the database records did not get deleted, even though I cannot see them on the display.
fields.summary: Comment Delete does not reindex issue

fields.description:
When an issues has a long list of very large comments ... like several paragraphs, it makes it really long and obnoxious ... it would be good to have the ability to click a minimize arrow next to the comment and have it be minimized to only the first 5 lines or something...

That would make display and using long discussed issues easier.
fields.summary: Ability to Minimize Large Comments

fields.description:
Hi 
We are currently using JIRA 1.4.3, we are planing to go for upgrade to 2.0.2.
We are looking for this workflow in JIRA specified below; How can I configure this.
Here are staes(statuses) which I need in the application
-------------
1) New (when created)
2) In Analysis
3) Need more information
4) In progress
5) Verify
6) Closed

From Status 2, we can goto Status 3 or 4.
From Status 3, we should be able to go back to Status 2.
then rest all is in numbering order.


Thanks in Advance
Madhu
fields.summary: How to Change the workflow to my requirement

fields.description: We would like a way to disable projects after some point in time?  We create new projects as we get new clients to track the issues for the short-term projects we do, and at some point, it would be nice to no longer have those projects appear.  At least not in the "create new issue" list, but possibly also remove them from issue reports.
fields.summary: Disabling projects

fields.description: The spacing of the "Description" and "Comments" tags differs by a little bit.  The description should probably have more left and right padding, to match the comments, change history, workflow history, and the top nav tabs.
fields.summary: Spacing of "tabs" differs

fields.description:
What about the ability to turn on/off a flag that says, "Show closed issues" for the road map.  The roadmap is great for viewing when issues are scheduled.  But the "outstanding" filter is better for viewing work is left to be done.  However, in the latter you can get a bit confused with what outstanding issues are applicable for which upcoming versions.  So you have to create a new outstanding filter for each version.

Having this flag on the roadmap would be a simple solution, allowing to view what open issues are left for future versions.  (This would help us during a rolling QA phase, allowing us to realign our resources given time constraints.)
fields.summary: Turn on/off closed issues in road map
Support wiki style writing in description and comments fields.

fields.description:
Sometimes it would be handy to be able to do an operation on multiple issues.

The operations I am thinking of are : assign, comment, move, link, watch.

One way I can think of is :
If the issue navigator would have a leftmost column with a checkbox to allow selection. Also buttons to select and deselect all.

The operations mentionned above would be listed below 'Save current filter'.
fields.summary: Ability to do some operations on multiple issues

fields.description:
Allow multiple selection of permission and group when managing permissions.

This would be particularly handy when creating a new project.
fields.summary: Multiple selection of permission and group when managing permissions

fields.description:
At out company we currently use JIRA within a project whose only deliverables are text documents.  In this project we use JIRA as a task list for the individual project members.  We create issues of type Task and assign them to the person in charge.  Usually we want to associate a "due date" with the task.

At first we solved this by adding a custom field "Due Date".  This was not quite satisfactory as we can't filter using this custom field.  Instead we now schedule the tasks with specific project versions.  The problem with this approach, however, is that a future version can't have a scheduled release date (which would be the due date for the issues fixed by that version).

I think it would be reasonable to have a way to specify a scheduled release date for a project's unreleased versions.
fields.summary: Scheduled release date for unreleased versions

fields.description:
I would find it very useful to get all of the issues on one page (fitting some criteria), particularly so I could save that whole report into excel or XML.

the page is http jira/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa under Issue navigator. 

The problem with the system at the moment is I'm restricted to 20 issues in the display, when downloading to excel I have to go on to next each time and do another download.  Then I have to patch the many excel sheets together.

Kind Regards 


Paul Hill
fields.summary: be able to set how many issues to display per page

fields.description: I find the recent history handy so it could be nice if I could have it displayed on my home page.
fields.summary: Create a portlet for the recent history

fields.description:
The search mechanism could be improved greatly by adding these features. We have alot of projects with common "COMPONENTS" and "VERSIONS" and need to be able to include these in 1 search.
Also we have found when you MOVE a task from one project to another the only history you get (like previous task #) is contained in the "CHANGE HISTORY" This (and COMMENTS) cannot be searched
fields.summary: Search facility should be able to search on "COMPONENT" or "VERSION" and search "COMMENTS" and "CHANGE HISTORY"
